website_summaries.verdict: It's hard to find a more well-rounded and reliable label maker in this price range, making this product a great deal.
pros: Distances itself from competitors with its one-touch formatting keys and printing along with professional-looking labels
cons: Several consumers wish that there was an easy way to access special characters and symbols from a main menu

customer_reviews.title: Major Mechanical Issues
customer_reviews.text: This product has some type of mechanical problem that is documented on the internet. After printing several labels it just stops working and a error message appears on the screen. After consulting the internet, I found a work around to get it going again, it involves taking out the tape cartridge and turning the take up spindle by hand about 6 revolutions. This does not solve the problem, just gets it working after a jam. Didn’t return it because I am able to get it working and the price was low enough. Would not purchase this again.
customer_reviews.author: Anita

customer_reviews.title: Great machine. Printing Cartridges not so much.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this machine. It is comfortable, intuitive and easy to use. I ordered one that came with 2 printing cartridges (1 black and 1 blue). I loaded the black first and tried several times to print labels but they kept coming out blank every time. So I popped it out and loaded the blue cartridge which works fine. So I've got 1 faulty cartridge. As for the blue, the print quality is very nice however appears to be fading well ahead of running out of tape. So overall I would say great machine but the print cartridges need some improvement.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Middel

customer_reviews.title: Perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Works great for me. I use it to label.. Well everything. I've gone nuts since I got it. I label my tool chests, light switches, everything. It takes 3 different sizes. A warning the 1/4 size prints off center the first time but centers up fine. To be fair I'm using third party rolls which are super cheap. Print all the things. Label all the things. I got this also because I had extra AAA batteries
customer_reviews.author: asev

customer_reviews.title: Terrible.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this and then my inlaws caught COVID19 and I didn’t get to use it because I had to travel back to the NorthEast to care for them. After a month I finally get home and resume my organization project and this label maker will not work. Never printed a single label. It read paper jam over and over again. I bought extra label cartridges and tried different cartridges and different brand of batteries. Nothing works. Instead of a normal 90 day return policy it was less than thirty days after delivery. Now I’m stuck with this non-functioning product and label cartridges I can’t use. Terrible. Horrible return policy on a horrible product!
customer_reviews.author: Shannon M Via

customer_reviews.title: Great label maker!
customer_reviews.text: Great label maker! I’ve used a Brother label maker at work but was always disappointed by the waste of the blank label tape it used when it advances to cut the label. This label maker uses small margins, so it cuts near the end of the word so you don’t waste the label tape. The label cartridge and printing is the same quality as a Brother and the maker is very easy to use. I highly recommend buying the power cord since this label maker uses 8 batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Karen M

customer_reviews.title: Portability is nice
customer_reviews.text: This is serviceable product for your labeling needs. It's portable, easy to use, and runs on AAA batteries. It loses a couple stars because of the tape headache. It was a pain to load, and then it occasionally jams or simply just prints crooked or on top of itself. In regards to the feedback that it doesn't waste a lot of white space, I agree and that's not my complaint. It's kind of like the printer in "Office Space" in that it's a little finicky on its printing. I also find that the tape doesn't adhere well to handles on Sterlite bins. I didn't take a star off for that, but just a note on functionality or lack thereof.
customer_reviews.author: JTStally

customer_reviews.title: Great, inexpensive, and fast to use.
customer_reviews.text: I like this labeler much more than I thought I would. It's very easy and fast to use, and does a great job of printing. Changing font size or going to all caps is a snap. I made about 50 garden plant labels in roughly 30 minutes. The only drawback is, if you want to ;print just one, it does not feed the printed label out far enough to cut it off without the loss of about 3/4" of blank stock. It would nave been nice if it actually feeds out to the end of the printed section, but it does not. It has to be pulled out.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Sahlin

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Overall great product. I’ve tested out the different fonts and sizes. My only reason for not giving it 5 stars is due to the insane amount of batteries required. You need 6 AAA batteries. They’re not included and advises you remove them when not using the printer. I found that a bit excessive. I tried to see if that info was listed anywhere but it was not. So just fair warning.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend: Defective product replaced with defective product
customer_reviews.text: Bought and used it immediately for a few labels. Tried using it two days ago. Label emerges but with only a few black marks here and there. Right after the label emerges, the screen indicates low battery. Switched batteries, but no improvement. Absolutely useless model. Or I received a dud. Will try to return or try and get a replacement. I do not recommend this product. UPDATE: Ordered the same product (first) and returned the defective one. The replacement had the same defect (though it shipped before I mailed my first one out). I will not only be avoiding this brand from now on, but will recommend to others that they go with another brand.
customer_reviews.author: SJV

customer_reviews.title: Money well spent
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had a label maker in a while and I use this for work. Easy and quick learning curve to use. The two line printing is great and only allows you print in font sizes that will fit on the tape (no mistakes). Very little waste of feed tape, Nice large LCD. Vertical printing is a nice feature. 2 extra 1/2 inch by 23 foot tapes with split back peel is awesome. The Best Bang for my Buck. Some times you just buy a product and say... money worth spending. This is one of them. I did and would recommend getting the hard case and it should last quite a while..
customer_reviews.author: MK-GraniteState

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I love my Dynmo! I have labeled my files, my notebooks, my folders for budget, etc. I am about to label my Guinea pig, Puff!
customer_reviews.author: Teresa N.

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to love it but 😡
customer_reviews.text: Well not sure where all the good reviews came from. Labels wouldn’t stick to anything they all either didn’t stick or fell off within hours. So had to send it back. Bought the cheaper one at Walmart’s and labels stay stuck to most things a few curl up at the corners after a while but much better result. Think Dymo might want to talk to 3M to sort their labels out. Has to have a bucket load of batteries and not rechargeable and no external power input. Seriously give this one a miss
customer_reviews.author: Phdinnis

customer_reviews.title: NOT easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 issues with this product: It is NOT intuitive how the menu works and it took some work to figure out how to get back to the letters once I got the symbols. I still don't know how I did it. Secondly, NO operation instructions...zip. you are on your own to wallow through the menu and hope for the best. Finally, an adapter was not included and that was NOT clear from the product description.
customer_reviews.author: GRT

customer_reviews.title: Basic, but that's a great thing!
customer_reviews.text: We bought one of these a while ago and it works great. The labels print consistently, it's easy to change between font options, etc. Basically, it has all the basic options you could want for standard labels without all sorts of crazy features most people will never need/use. We wanted to get another label maker as a gift for my parents and knew they would appreciate many of the other positive features of this label maker. -Display is large enough to read easily -Buttons are big enough to type without a bunch of typos -Buttons have characters large enough to read easily Sure enough, the recipient loves this.
customer_reviews.author: RAD Resort

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable keyboard and easy setup
customer_reviews.text: This label maker is easy to use and has a great QWERTY keyboard for easy typing. There are 3 main sizes and several formatting options for the text. Printing takes a few seconds and then you can easily stick them where you please. The label maker uses 6 AAA batteries and I also purchased 2 cartridges which should be more than enough to start with.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: IT DOESNT COME WITH A POWER CORD OR BATTERIES!!!
customer_reviews.text: How cheap are you really? I saw nothing that specified this does not have a power cord that i would have to buy it separately. Also doesnt even come with batteries which is absurd. Now after being excited to use this all day I receive it in a state that cannot be currently used. Wtf
customer_reviews.author: John III

customer_reviews.title: Misleading picture
customer_reviews.text: It has two label tapes on the picture, I thought when I bought the machine it has two tapes with it, when I got it, there are no tapes and no batteries, it is very misleading, I do not mind buying labels then I would order them together. But when I got it, I have to order separately, it is misleading
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Preissner

customer_reviews.title: Better than Brother
customer_reviews.text: I have used cheap Brother P-Touch label makers for years. Decided to give this Dymo a try since it has more features for the price. I have not been disappointed. There are many more text sizes, less wasted space on printed labels, and the backing on the tape is split down the middle making it infinitely easier to peel as compared to the Brother. I don't think the tape feels as sticky as the Brother tape, but so far it hasn't peeled off of anything.
customer_reviews.author: JCR

customer_reviews.title: Does what it is suppose to do
customer_reviews.text: Came with 2 ribbons one broke after inserting. Wrapped around rubber wheel. Good thing it came with 2 ribbons. Dissapointed now i dont have a spare
customer_reviews.author: JOHN J.

customer_reviews.title: I wish I'd bought it sooner
customer_reviews.text: Mine didn't come with the external power supply that it has the option of using, but I don't recall seeing it listed as part of the package deal. Was listed at $28 and I'm thrilled with it "as-is". I used this to label my spark plugs and wires and custom wiring for my Jeep; this way I don't have to rely on memory in case I have to perform repairs years from now. I should also have ordered the shrink tube ribbons for my applications.
customer_reviews.author: Honest reviews

customer_reviews.title: Great so far
customer_reviews.text: works well easy to use. Love that you can buy the paper and at a low cost. Love to label stuff. Wish it came with a case. Probably my only complaint because just wanting it to be reachable with a pull and then make it portable that way.
customer_reviews.author: Linda W.

customer_reviews.title: The Best Label Printer for the Money
customer_reviews.text: This is (in my Opinion) one of the Very Best Label Printers you can buy for the money. I have already used it to make 100's of Labels. All Sizes with All Kinds of Symbols and Fonts. This thing is So Cool. I've been using the 6mm & the 12mm label sizes the Most. I love this label maker.
customer_reviews.author: Philip W.

customer_reviews.title: Great for the office or at home
customer_reviews.text: this label maker is easy to use and is hard worker it has a turn off timer so you don't use up all the battery. I use it for the hole day labeling network cables, bin's , etc. It did not give any signs of slowing down or any thing. am happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: What a lovely labeler
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use and versatile, allowing multiple sizes of print. I did not find anything to complain about after reading reviews prior to purchasing and following some suggestions. And I do not waste tape from cartridge with a little planning and multiple labels printed at once. Still great printing one label at a time as well.
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: Could be easier to get to the ! but otherwise EXACTLY as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Could be easier to get to the ! but otherwise EXACTLY as advertised - Also jams a bit but the cartridge has plenty of tape. (Buy extra tape up-front!! the ones that come with are 1/3rd the length of a real one)
customer_reviews.author: AlexM

customer_reviews.title: worked great initially!
customer_reviews.text: i made 10 labels over 2 months, then it just quit working. batteries still good. tried troubleshooting in manual and online. it repeatedly says label jam. too late to return it. i’m very bummed, it worked great initially!
customer_reviews.author: happy gilmore

customer_reviews.title: Quality Item
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my condo association, so that we can place names on mailboxes and call boxes. I want it all to look uniform, it looks great and you have options with the font color and size.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry H

customer_reviews.title: VERY HAPPY WITH THIS LABEL MAKER
customer_reviews.text: This is my first label maker so i was a bit skeptical. I received this very quickly and was well packaged.THIS DYMO D160 is very easy to operate and navigate.The buttons are very comfy to push on,they feel like they have a padding on them..the printing is very nice...im very happy with this product...i would definitely buy it again..im actually thinking of buying one for my boyfriend and mother....dont be scared to buy this...its a very good product for the money
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa 1971

customer_reviews.title: Don’t do it
customer_reviews.text: Tape jammed on first print. Something is loose, big waste of money. In the middle of moving so I tossed the box and receipt otherwise I would send it back when I get the time
customer_reviews.author: AMY M

customer_reviews.title: Great label maker
customer_reviews.text: Just like what the title says. Very easy to use interface. I would recommend buying the power adaptor. I had the batteries leak inside the label maker.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Tran

customer_reviews.title: Basic use
customer_reviews.text: Beware you need a million batteries to use this! However, the tape available is great and easy to peel off the backing. We have only used for basic things so far and it's been just fine. If we tried something fancy it might be a little more challenging. It does leave space before and after the text, and I've just trimmed it off so far.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to organize and label my kitchen. I wasted a lot of ink/label because it would get off track or the ink would not show up completely. Overall eventually does the job, but once in awhile it goes back to doing the same thing.
customer_reviews.author: Kitty

customer_reviews.title: Great cheap label maker
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to label servers, didn't know label makers were so cheap. $28~ for the combo? Great deal. Super easy to use and works well. Make sure to double check batteries, I thought these took 3x AA (saw it somewhere) but the LM 160 takes 6x AAA. Label refills are expensive but that's to be expected with any devices like these.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Good investment!!!
customer_reviews.text: Item came on time in perfect condition with two tape cartridges. Works very well however, it jammed a couple times but it was a easy fix. It does waste quite a bit of tape. This was a good investment, I would recommend!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sheena

customer_reviews.title: Pretty cool tool
customer_reviews.text: This thing is super easy to use. I did not need the directions at all. One issue though was that I got two tapes (I bought them- it does NOT come with one or batteries it also does not come with a AC adapter) One of the tapes did not work and it took a few weeks to get here so to send it back for the tape isnt worth it. The one tape that did work has made my garage so organized that I can find something in a snap.
customer_reviews.author: Laurdess

customer_reviews.title: Hard to find and use special characters.
customer_reviews.text: We use a lot of special characters ($, #, %, etc.), but you have to scroll through all of the symbols to find what you need. Would not recommend if you need to use symbols a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan G.

customer_reviews.title: Big, seems nice but wasted tape is inevitable as it won’t thread through properly.
customer_reviews.text: It is hard to thread tape through. Sounds like it prints but you have to pull tape out so it will thread out. I see a LOT of wasted tape in my future. I would like to return but threw out the box (dummy me!). I guess it will go to goodwill and I will go to Office Depot and get something I know will work!
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great price
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. Highly recommend this as it's much easier to handle than the wider 150 model. i appreciate that two cartridges are included. Not happy at all with the delivery technique. See video....
customer_reviews.author: David Williams

customer_reviews.title: Labeling
customer_reviews.text: Great price for this product, fast shipping easy to use
customer_reviews.author: Sheila Teal

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, didn't even read the manual. Buttons are easy to press accept the direction to go left, right, up, & down. Tape is easy to load. Took 1 star because batteries are not included and you need 6 to run this gadget. Also you need to buy a separate adaptor.
customer_reviews.author: jim patrick

customer_reviews.title: Works pretty good. Does what I need
customer_reviews.text: I originally received an open box that was missing tapes. I inquired for a replacement and got the replacement within 2 days and everything was good with the new one. The label maker is very intuitive to use and has helped me tremendously in learning a new language. (The apartment is covered in labels). Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: ismynamehi

customer_reviews.title: DOA
customer_reviews.text: Following the instructions, I loaded fresh batteries and then the tape cartridge. The machine made noises while registering the cartridge. However, the ON button does not turn the unit on. Replacing the batteries with an complete different set failed to active the device.
customer_reviews.author: N. Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Works so well everything gets a label now!
customer_reviews.text: Waited way to long to buy one if these. Funny how everything had a label now. Initially bought for labeling LAN drops in my home. Now all power cords are labeled as well. Have fun!
customer_reviews.author: RuckedUp

customer_reviews.title: Piece of crap. Better off using a sharpee and tape
customer_reviews.text: Seemed easy enough to use at first and it was, for the first 5 print and cuts. Then, label jam... Can't get it unjamed. Can't even figure out what the heck is jammed up. No instructions to troubleshoot. After about a week of wasting my time reaching my boiling point trying , it felt incredibly good to smash this thing against the concrete. What a crappy product AND it doesn't stick to surfaces either! POS.
customer_reviews.author: Kirstine Gates

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Love this LabelMaker. Are used it on all of my lights switches and it helps very much. You can adjust the font size and it’s easy to use
customer_reviews.author: Leslie  Lysy

customer_reviews.title: My best friend
customer_reviews.text: This printer has become my best friend! I’ve already organized my garage and several other spaces in my home! I love how easy it is to replace the printing tape, so far I’ve used it nearly every day since I received it. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Nickel

customer_reviews.title: Broken printhead
customer_reviews.text: Product came. Printhead appears broken from what the technical helper said (though nothing visible- it just wont print any text but spits out blank label tape). Help was good but I was on hold 41 minutes before they could help me. I thought I wasn’t stupid for it not working bc it’s so simple so I didn’t initiate the return in the appropriate window for amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Holly G

customer_reviews.title: Nice little thing!
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful little thing. You can label lots of things with it. The tape was not enough but I had to buy a back up when I purchased the label maker so it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little label maker
customer_reviews.text: It’s a little tedious to get to special characters, but it’s easy to use in every other way and makes high quality labels.
customer_reviews.author: Picky consumer

customer_reviews.title: mine was defective
customer_reviews.text: I received a defective product. Even though I placed brand new batteries into the product, the screen would still show “low battery”. Also, the ink did not print on the labels. Thankfully amazon accepted the return late and gave me a full refund. Very disappointed that it didn’t work.
customer_reviews.author: Laura D

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: I wished I had returned this but it’s too late , started malfunctioning a bit later, I would rather invest in a better one.
customer_reviews.author: lovetoshoptillidrop

customer_reviews.title: No good
customer_reviews.text: Did not work. It never printed out anything no matter how I adjusted the label
customer_reviews.author: Electric Vegan Girl

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work
customer_reviews.text: Every time we tried to use the label maker to tape would jam up. Sending back.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: I recommend. Does mot include batteries or charger
customer_reviews.text: Label maker works just as described. I expected batteries and charger but did not read about all inclusions. Would recommend and purchase again!
customer_reviews.author: Fabian Chavez

customer_reviews.title: A good pickup for staying organized
customer_reviews.text: This label maker works great. I recently moved a lot of items into boxes, and labelling them made the process super easy. The user interface isn't great, but it's easy enough to use when you get the hang of it. The printing quality is clear, and it even supports special symbols. Overall, worth it for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Phil55

customer_reviews.title: Its Okay
customer_reviews.text: Its pretty good, once you get the hang of how it works..not too user friendly. If you don't have some smarts..you wont figure out all of the features for a while..maybe after a few tries
customer_reviews.author: Kecia F.

customer_reviews.title: A very nice unit
customer_reviews.text: After I cleared a problem with the advance mechanism, it worked like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Barry M. Lunt

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. The only thing that did not meet my expectations is that you can’t change the size you print the text.
customer_reviews.author: Erik with a K

customer_reviews.title: Won’t auto feed.  Waste tape by having to pull tape out from slot so that it will print.
customer_reviews.text: Prints out ok. But when cutting it cuts too short and will not automatically feed. You need to waste around 2-3 inches by pulling out of the slot where tape comes out from. Waste of money on that part. But once printing it’s ok.
customer_reviews.author: pro

customer_reviews.title: Good label maker. Bad sticker quality.
customer_reviews.text: The label maker works really well. The labels themselves don't seem to stick.
customer_reviews.author: kdizz

customer_reviews.title: didn't work
customer_reviews.text: I opened the package, put AAA batteries, put label. Tried test printing and it jams. Returning the product.
customer_reviews.author: leadpan

customer_reviews.title: Good printer once it starts working correctly
customer_reviews.text: Started to jam on first printed label. But I cleared it out and it happened twice. After that it has worked great. I’ll just chalk it up to the printer warming up for the abuse I’m going to put it through. 🤪
customer_reviews.author: Edem Ingram Sr.

customer_reviews.title: This was a gift
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift. They seem to like it quite well. I am not in a position to judge.
customer_reviews.author: Outdoer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for labeling Electronic Components
customer_reviews.text: I have cases of electronic parts and needed to label them. Great Price and extra cartridge included.
customer_reviews.author: Alex C.

customer_reviews.title: Great label maker
customer_reviews.text: I love this little Label Maker. It came in handy while I was organizing my files in my office. I also used it to label & organize my spice jars.
customer_reviews.author: Meg’s_Finds

customer_reviews.title: Worked well when I first got it but not any more only 2 uses
customer_reviews.text: Worked well when I first got it , I left it in my office draw and 2 months later it will not work. I tried batteries even power cord and different ribbons. Will contact for a return or exchange.
customer_reviews.author: KM

customer_reviews.title: Battery and power adapter NOT included
customer_reviews.text: There's a port for a power adapter but none was included, so you have to use 6 AAA batteries
customer_reviews.author: A. L. G.

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, makes labels
customer_reviews.text: It takes a sec to explore everything and figure it out, but it's pretty straightforward once you use it and see how it's setup. I love it, I'm so much more organized at work, and people have a harder time lifting my stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer of goods

customer_reviews.title: Makes life easier
customer_reviews.text: I bout it for my business and boy is this thing handy I don’t need to print from Computer cut and tape anymore
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Great Product - was bigger than expected
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up! Easy to use. Came with printing tape. Only issue was that it didn't come with the ac adapter. I had to buy that separately.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Orlando Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Good deal
customer_reviews.text: Works well. It's a fun little gadet and functional for what we needed (labelling electric components). The only downside is the interface takes a little time to figure out. I printed words in mistaken fonts or mistaken sizes before I got what I wanted. Overall good deal for the price IMO.
customer_reviews.author: ToriLou

customer_reviews.title: HIGHLY RECOMMEND
customer_reviews.text: easy to used,offered different print size and good choice on Clipart!
customer_reviews.author: Floridian Indian

customer_reviews.title: Not user friendly
customer_reviews.text: I love it but it didn’t have good directions at all. Don’t sixes are nice. Good features once u figure it out
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bought as a replacement for second smaller label maker
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my second smaller Dymo label maker with this one. I like the keyboard better and am hoping it lasts longer. The labels don't stick very well, just like the other labels but I use a bit of clear tape over them and it does the treat.
customer_reviews.author: Dale Green

customer_reviews.title: Missing Tapes
customer_reviews.text: Never received the 2 tapes which I added via drop down for extra $10 Also says it comes with a 1/2 roll which I didn't get either in Q&A section
customer_reviews.author: Zak Pellecchia

customer_reviews.title: Great label maker
customer_reviews.text: Great label maker for the classroom! I have had it for almost a year. It works great and I would recommend it. I bought a carrying case for it as well.
customer_reviews.author: Elissa

customer_reviews.title: perfect
customer_reviews.text: exactly what I needed. Can print in different font sizes, bold, underline, italics, etc. Comes with 2 rolls of tape as well. Great deal
customer_reviews.author: matthew wade

customer_reviews.title: Labels don't stick
customer_reviews.text: Well, the labeler is easy to use and has less waste than Brother when printing single labels. However the adhesive on the labels is horrible. Plan to cover them with clear tape that DOES adhere. I wasn't really going for a two part solution here.
customer_reviews.author: Beachladyzz

customer_reviews.title: Labels not very sticky
customer_reviews.text: Great device but sadly the labels are not very sticky so defeats the purpose. Otherwise I would give it 5-stars
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne M. Nicholl

customer_reviews.title: Tape keeps getting stuck.
customer_reviews.text: It did not work. The tape keeps getting stuck in side.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Wright

customer_reviews.title: I’ve received a label maker that was not working, was damaged.
customer_reviews.text: I’m really disappointed about this product. I’ve bought this Dymo Label Manager and was so excited to use, but the product that I’ve received was not working. The two color labels that comes with were not good as well, the printing label had no text, like it was fading away the letters. I don’t know if the problem was the print head of the label manager machine or the black or blue label. Anyway, I had no option than return the product.
customer_reviews.author: Cristiana Jacobsohn

customer_reviews.title: DYMO Label Maker with 2 D1 DYMO Label Tapes
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used this product yet but I never had a problem with DYMO Label Maker.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Y. Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I like this label maker, but it is very simple and doesn't have to many extra features. It is great for day to day use. I use it at work and it fits my need.
customer_reviews.author: L_0712

customer_reviews.title: Great organizing tool
customer_reviews.text: I got this label maker in order to label the items in my pantry to help me be better organized. I love it. Easy to use, not too expensive, and it does what I need it to. Perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Tattuke

customer_reviews.title: Good printing
customer_reviews.text: I give it 3 stars only because it only works if it is plugged in. Batteries don't work on it. I had to buy a charger for it. But since I don't label often, I don't mind plugging it in when I need to print a label.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Ruiz

customer_reviews.title: Decent price
customer_reviews.text: Fairly bulky, I'm not sure what they still use six AAA batteries so I bought a power adapter. Works great, decent price
customer_reviews.author: Shawn E.

customer_reviews.title: Great starter label maker
customer_reviews.text: I love it. Easy to use and perfect for its intended use
customer_reviews.author: kenzie

customer_reviews.title: I love this label maker
customer_reviews.text: I love this label maker. It was a great buy! I use it all the time, I have very non-techy family members, so I label a lot of things for them. The remotes, electrical chords, and so much more. This has helped a ton.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Great label maker!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with item. So much easier to just grab it and make labels than to use Microsoft word on a computer and deal with a printer. Downfall is you can't be creative with your labels but it's very convenient and to the point.
customer_reviews.author: Mari M

customer_reviews.title: Waiste of money
customer_reviews.text: After 10 labels it displayed label feeder jam. Tried everything never got it to work again
customer_reviews.author: Аmazon Custome

customer_reviews.title: Obsessed
customer_reviews.text: Love this label maker. Easy to use for all labeling projects. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: Pick a different one
customer_reviews.text: Had to return for different model. This one would not print anything.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is very easy to use, I didn’t even read the directions and was able to start printing labels right away. I can get all the sizes I need as well.
customer_reviews.author: L.roths

customer_reviews.title: Works great/would recommend
customer_reviews.text: I had an older version of this and this one is works better and has more features. Works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Iluvjeeps

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: Directly out of the box with, from what I’m reading is a systemic software failure they have no fix for. I tried the multitude of “Factory Reset” procedures but the product is unresponsive and I am unable to turn it off.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: bad product
customer_reviews.text: Actually i do not recommend anyone to buy this product, bad Quality! i did bad choice
customer_reviews.author: shaker nasser

customer_reviews.title: Best buy for Price
customer_reviews.text: Gave this as a gift, she loves it! Great selection of type styles and size of letters.
customer_reviews.author: Linn Floral City

customer_reviews.title: DIDNT print
customer_reviews.text: DIDNT work right out of the box, purchased adapter didn’t fix the issue. (Would not print)
customer_reviews.author: Mercedes Galyon

customer_reviews.title: There is no clear button on this label maker
customer_reviews.text: The label maker works very well as advertised, but after you've printed a label and want to create a new label you must individually delete each character on the screen before creating the next label.. Why on earth wouldn't there be a clear key to clear the screen???? Very irritating..
customer_reviews.author: BoomerD

customer_reviews.title: Better add another $8 in cost to this one!
customer_reviews.text: Able to start printing labels right away, well, once you install the batteries that is. Most items like this I have come across come WITH the batteries needed. This item does not, so be prepared to use 6AA batteries right off the bat. Otherwise I would have given this a 5 star rating.
customer_reviews.author: Wookie03

product_meta.title: DYMO Label Maker with 2 D1 DYMO Label Tapes | LabelManager 160 Portable Label Maker, QWERTY Keyboard, One-Touch Smart Keys, Easy-to-Use, For Home & Office Organization
product_meta.description: The DYMO LabelManager 160 is a fast, simple label maker that's easy to take with you. Quickly type text on the computer-style QWERTY keyboard, edit with one-touch fast-formatting keys, and print perfect, professional labels every time. Compact and lightweight for portability, making it easy to label just about anything, anywhere. 20+ ways to format text and more than 200 symbols and clip-art make it easy to create high-quality labels for all your organization needs. To extend the battery life, the auto power-off function turns the label maker off when not in use.
feature_bullets: PORTABLE LABEL MAKER: Compact and lightweight for portability, making it easy to label just about anything, anywhere

TYPE QUICKLY AND EASILY: Label maker lets you quickly type text on the familiar computer style QWERTY keyboard, edit with one touch fast formatting keys and print perfect, professional labels every time
PRINTS CUSTOM LABELS: Choose from 20 plus ways to format text and 200 plus symbols and clip art allows for personalization
EXTENDED BATTERY LIFE: Enjoy extended battery life with automatic switch off

USE WITH AUTHENTIC DYMO LABELS: For best performance, use authentic DYMO D1 label tapes. This set includes 2 D1 Starter Label Cassettes (Black on White and Blue on White in size 1/2 inches x 10 inches)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars792 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
